content:
Diagnosis:	Metastatic adenocarcinoma of left lower lobe lung with bone and brain metastases

Management:	2023 Dec - Whole brain radiotherapy
		2024 Jan - Started Carboplatin/Paclitaxel/Trastuzumab

Histology:	Adenocarcinoma, HER2 amplified, PD-L1 20%

Current Situation:	Pre-cycle 4 chemotherapy review

I reviewed [redacted name] today prior to cycle 4 of systemic therapy. She is tolerating treatment relatively well with grade 1 fatigue and mild peripheral neuropathy affecting fingertips only. Her headaches have significantly improved following whole brain radiotherapy. Recent staging CT chest/abdomen/pelvis (15 March 2024) shows stable disease in primary lung lesion and bone metastases. MRI brain (12 March 2024) confirms partial response of brain metastases with reduction in size and surrounding edema.

Performance status remains 1. She continues to live independently with support from her daughter. She is managing regular short walks and light housework.

Plan to proceed with cycle 4 chemotherapy today. Will arrange repeat imaging after cycle 6. Follow-up appointment in 3 weeks.

cancer_timeline.value: CT shows stable disease in primary lung lesion and bone metastases
MRI brain confirms partial response of brain metastases with reduction in size and surrounding edema

patient_facts.value: Living independently, managing regular short walks and light housework

status_updates.value: Stage IV lung adenocarcinoma with brain and bone metastases. Stable disease on combination chemotherapy with Trastuzumab, good partial response of brain metastases post radiotherapy
Stable disease in primary and bone metastases, partial response in brain metastases
Grade 1 fatigue and mild peripheral neuropathy
